questions.question: Who is the poet of the poem 'Be The Best'?
questions.answer: Douglas Malloch

questions.question: What is the main theme of the poem 'Be The Best'?
questions.answer: Self-improvement

questions.question: According to the poem, what should you do if you cannot be a pine tree?
questions.answer: Be a shrub

questions.question: What does the poet encourage us to do?

options.text: Be the best of whatever you are

questions.answer: Be the best of whatever you are

questions.question: Which quality is highlighted in the poem?
questions.answer: Self-confidence

questions.question: The poem suggests success depends on?
questions.answer: Effort

questions.question: What does 'trail' symbolize in the poem?
questions.answer: Journey of effort

questions.question: Who should be the best according to the poem?
questions.answer: Everyone

questions.question: What tone does the poem have?
questions.answer: Motivational

questions.question: The poem teaches us to value?
questions.answer: Effort and sincerity

questions.question: What is the central idea of the poem 'Be The Best'?
questions.answer: The poem teaches us to do our best in whatever role we have in life.

questions.question: What message does the poet give through the poem?
questions.answer: Everyone is important and should try to be the best in their own position.

questions.question: Why does the poet mention different things like pine, shrub, bush, and grass?
questions.answer: To show that every role is valuable and no role is small.

questions.question: How does the poem motivate students?
questions.answer: It encourages students to have confidence and give their best effort.

questions.question: Explain the line 'If you can’t be a highway, then just be a trail.'
questions.answer: It means even small roles are meaningful if done sincerely.
